name: All
description: A folder of all the different subsections settings are broken into.

name: Metadata and Exports
description: A folder containing extraneous data for the loadout itself.

elements.text: The displayed name of the loadout.
Displayed to other players viewing your settings. Can help with organization.
Does not affect the game. Max length of 32 characters
Pressing the Export Loadout button will download a text file.
Save this file to automatically add your loadout without save data.
To Import, create a new loadout and upload the text file after selecting the 'Import' option

name: Personal Settings
description: A folder containing settings that can differ between individual players, when not constrained by the host.

name: Tank Attributes
description: A folder containing the player's tank's attributes.

elements.text: Controls the color your tank is shown as.
This value cannot be constrained, however depending on team settings it is possible to spawn with a different color.
Note that the color you see may be different from others, depending on your selected theme.
There are 55 possible colors, or random chooses a random one each time you spawn.
Controls the mass of your tank, or how resistant it is to outside forces.
For example, a tank with a mass of 10g will have a force advantage over a tank with a mass of 1g.
Individual motion is unaffected, only reactionary forces.
Values may be between 0.01g to 1000000g. The default value is 100g.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the speed of your tank, or the fastest it is able to move before being unable to accelerate.
This does not influence acceleration, ie. faster speed means faster overall acceleration to match.
Values may be between 0.01ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 100ψ.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the time it takes your tank to reach maximum speed.
For example, a 4 second acceleration means the tank will gain 25% of its max speed over 4 seconds, when accelerating from rest.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 0.1s.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls how your velocity dampens over time.
The percentage represents the amount of velocity left over after a second of time.
For example, a tank with 10% dampening and 100ψ/s speed will move 10ψ/s after 1s, and 1ψ/s after 2s.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 10%.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the speed your tank rotates, measures in degrees per second.
For example, a rotation speed of 90° will see a tank making a full rotation every 4 seconds.
Values may be between 0°/s to 1000000°/s. The default value is 90°/s.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the size of the tank, measured in tonk units.
Values may be between 0.01ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 300ψ.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.

name: Tank Health Attributes
description: A folder containing the player's tank's health attributes.

elements.text: Controls the total amount of damage a tank can sustain before dying.
Damage dealt over resistance eats from this value. It can be restored by regen and powerups, but otherwise remains constant.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 100hp.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the amount of health tanks gain over time, while regen is active.
Health is restored in both raw and percentage values.
Note percentage values are based on the total damage done.
For example, 10% regen on a 40% health tank would heal them to 46% after the first second.
Health is restored smoothly every second when regen is active.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 10hp.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value is 0%.
Both may be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the amount of time tanks must spend without taking damage before regen activates.
When damaged, this timer resets and a player must wait again for it to finish.
Values may be between 0s to 1000000s. The default value is 10s.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the amount of damage subtracted from each hit.
For example, if you have 10 damage resist, getting hit with a 50 damage bullet will only deal 40 points of damage.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 0hp.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the amount of extra lives your tank has.
If you would die, instead an extra life is used and you do not suffer negative consequences for death.
This can mean respawning in most gamemodes, not losing points in arena, or not changing teams. This setting does not affect the Capture The Flag gamemode.
Values may be between 0L to 1000000L. The default value is 0L. Values will be rounded down to the nearest whole number.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.

name: Camera and Vision
description: A folder containing the settings for the tank's FOV and lights.

elements.text: Controls the vision aspect of the tank.
Vision defines the scaling of what you see, and how far you can see things.
Your raw vision does not affect lighting, but instead controls what lights you are able to see.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 5000ψ.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the size of the camera's light bubble..
The bubble is the illuminated area around the camera, in which objects can be seen.
This is the circumference of the bubble, so a bubble with size equal to your vision will have a length the size of the screen.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 4000ψ.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the strength/opacity of the camera's vision bubble.
A value of 0% means the light does nothing. A value of 100% means the bubble fully illuminates the area is covers.
Light sources can stack, such that where two 50% opacity lights meet, the area will be 75% illuminated.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 90%.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls if the camera is locked to the center of the map.
When Enabled, the camera is put in the center of the map.
When Disabled, the camera is attached to the tank itself.
The default value is Disabled.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls the arc, or starting and ending angle, of the tank's camera's vision bubble.
Your beam of light begins at the starting arc value, and ends at the ending arc value.
The front of your tank is at 0°, and the beam goes clockwise to the endpoint.
For example, an arc of 315° to 45° will create a 90° arc emitted from the front of the tank.
An arc of 45° to 315° will be do the opposite, and create a 270° arc emitted from the back of the tank.
Values for both the starting and ending angle may be between 0° to 360°. The default value is a 0° starting angle, and 360° ending angle.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls who can and can't see the camera's vision bubble.
Everyone means that all other players will have your light source appear.
Enemies Only means that only enemies will see your camera's light source. This can be good for inverted lights and concealing effects.
Teammates Only allows for tanks on your team to see your camera's light source as well.
Self Only means that only you can see your camera's light source.
The default value is Self Only
May be locked, or unlocked by the host.
Controls who can and can't see the camera's vision bubble.
When enabled, the player's camera pierces shadow casting objects.
When disabled, shadow casters like walls block player vision behind then.
The default value is Disabled
May be locked, or unlocked by the host.
Controls if players can have their own extra light sources.
When enabled, the host's light attachments are shared between all players.
When disabled, people can have their own light sources.
The default value is Enabled

name: Light Attachments
description: A folder containing all the lights in your loadout.

name: Lights All
description: A folder containing all the light settings.

elements.text: Controls the name of the light.
This is only visible in the editor, and helps to distinguish between different lights.
Controls where the light is attached to the tank.
Values are measured relative to the size of the tank, with 100% being the radius.
Positive X values move the light towards the front of the tank from the center, negative towards the back.
Positive Y values move the light to the clockwise side of the tank, negative move it towards the counterclockwise side.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value for both is 0%.
Controls the area the attached light will cover.
Measured as the radius of the bubble formed by the attached light.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 1000ψ.
Controls the opacity of the attached light.
0% means the light is not visible, 100% means it fully illuminates the area it covers.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 90%.
Controls the arc of the attached light.
The beam of light begins at the starting arc value, and ends at the ending arc value.
The front of the tank light is attached to is 0°, and the beam goes clockwise to the endpoint.
For example, an arc of 315° to 45° will create a 90° arc emitted parallel to the front of the tank.
An arc of 45° to 315° will be do the opposite, and create a 270° arc emitted parallel to the back of the tank.
Values for both the starting and ending angle may be between 0° to 360°. The default value is a 0° starting angle, and 360° ending angle.
Controls the who can see the attached light.
Everyone means anyone can see the light.
Enemies Only means only people on the opposite team can see the attached light.
Teammates Only means only people on the same team as the tank can see the light.
Self Only means only the tank this is attached to can see the light.
The default value is Self Only.
Controls if the attached light pierces walls.
When Enabled, the light ignores obstacles.
When disabled, obstacles that block vision obstruct the light source.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls when the attached light is visible.
When the flashlight is on, only light sources with Visible When Lights On appear.
Alternatively, when the flashlight is off, only light sources with Visible When Lights Off appear.
The default value for both is Enabled.
Controls if the attached light requires equipping a specific powerup to be visible.
If the selected powerup is actively equipped, it can show, otherwise it will not appear.
If no weapon is selected, it will always attempt to appear if the light toggle is correct.
Weapons are referenced by id, meaning changing the name or properties of the weapon will not force you to change this setting.

name: Miscellaneous Personal
description: A folder containing the personal settings that didn't belong in another folder.

elements.text: Controls the opacity of the tank.
A value of 0% means the tank is fully invisible to to others. A value of 100% means the tank is fully visible.
The controller of the tank sees themselves as 20% more opaque, for the sake of letting them effectively control themselves.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 100%.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls if the health and shield bars of the tank are visible to players.
When enabled, the percentage of health is represented, and the shield bar overlays with the relevant percentage of max health.
When disabled, no one is able to see the tank's health bar.
The default value is Enabled.
May be locked or unlocked by the host.
Controls the amount of powerups the tank can backpack until they run out of room.
For example, if the tank has a single default powerup, a value of 2σ would let the tank hold their default, and one other powerup.
All powerups are kept in storage, and equipping a new powerup moves your existing powerup into storage, or puts it directly into storage depending on settings.
Equipping powerups from storage may be done via hotkey, or by pressing e to open the equip menu and choosing a powerup.
Values may be between 0σ to 100σ. The default value is 2σ.
May be locked, unlocked, or constrained by the host.
Controls where collected powerups are put.
Automatically Equip means collected powerups are put over existing equipped powerups when collected.
Equip Over Default means that collected powerups will only equip over weapons with the Treat As Default setting Enabled.
Collect Unequipped means the powerup is put in the back of the player's backpack when collected.
The default value is Equip Over Default.
May be locked or unlocked by the host.

name: Server Settings
description: A folder containing settings that apply to the server and all players as a whole.

name: Gamemode
description: A folder containing the options for how the game works and functions on a fundamental level.

elements.text: Controls the gamemode used in the game.
Standard: the round ends when only one team remains.
Arena: dying and killing loses and earns points, whoever has the most at the end wins.
Tag: killing a player turns them to your team, goes until everyone is on the same team.
Monarch: teams have a king, and if the king dies the entire team loses.
King of the Hill: players are assigned the crown, and must keep it long enough to win.
The default value is Standard.
Controls the rounds of the game played before returning to the lobby.
Note the host can force the game back to the lobby by pressing the same key used to start a game.
Total wins can only be seen on the leaderboard from the lobby, to make it dramatic if you want.
Values may be between 1r to 100r. The default value is 1r.
Controls the starting and ending timer for each round.
The Starting Timer is how long players have to prepare while locked in place before the round starts.
The Ending Timer is how long players have to look at the end state and the leaderboard when a round finishes.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value for ending is 2s, and starting is 0s.

name: Standard
description: A folder containing the options for the standard gamemode, used when it is selected.

elements.text: Controls how long tanks take to revive in the standard gamemode.
After reviving, tanks spawn in at a random location on the map.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s.
Controls how long tanks must be the last standing to earn a point in standard gamemode.
After all other teams / tanks are eliminated, this timer starts.
If no players are alive at the end of the timer, the round ends in a draw. Otherwise, each player on the surviving team gets a point.
Note players respawning due to extra lives count as living for round end purposes.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 2s to 5s.

name: Arena
description: A folder containing the options for the arena gamemode, used when it is selected.

elements.text: Controls how long tanks take to revive in the arena gamemode.
After reviving, tanks spawn in at a random location on the map.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s.
Controls how long rounds last in the arean gamemode.
Once the timer hits 0, the player with the most score gets a point.
In the case of a draw, the drawn handling setting controls how the round proceeds.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 30s to 90s with 15s rounding interval.
Controls how many points different events give or take away in arena mode.
Points On Kill controls how many points tanks get when killing an enemy.
Points Lost On Death controls how many points are lost when a player dies to an enemy.
Points Lost On Suicide controls how many points are lost when a player dies to a player on the same team.
Kill and Death are separate and do not apply to friendly fire deaths
Values may be between 0pt to 100pt. The default values are 5pt per kill, 1pt lost per death, and 1pt lost per suicide.
Controls how drawn games are handled in arena mode.
Instant Death continues the game with all players. The game ends as soon as the draw is broken.
Faceoff functions similarly to instant death, however tanks that are not part of the draw are turned into ghosts.
Random Winners chooses a person at random from the drawn tanks, and gives them a point to end the round.
Shared Winners gives all drawn players a point to end the round.
No Winners ends the round without giving any players a point.
The default value is Instant Death.

name: Tag
description: A folder containing the options for the tag gamemode, used when it is selected.

elements.text: Controls how many times tanks can be tagged before turning into ghosts.
Since tag does not have points, this setting can prevent tanks from purposefully switching teams.
A value of 0 means tanks can switch teams indefinitely.
Values may be between 0tag to 1000000tag. The default value is 0tag.
Controls if being tagged changes the team of your existing projectiles.
If projectiles are set to die with tank, then this setting is obsolete, as tagging a tank will delete all their existing projectiles already.
When Enabled, when a tank gets tagged all of their active bullets change teams with them.
When Disabled, the bullets remain the original team.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if being tagged causes the tagged player to teleport to a random location.
When Enabled, being tagged randomizes your location.
When Disabled, the tank still changes teams, but remains in the same location.
The default value for Teleport on Tag is Disabled.
You may also choose to have a different option when a tank uses an extra life (and therefore does not switch teams when they die).
The default value for Teleport on Extra Life is Enabled.
Controls what team dying to friendly fire puts you on.
Keep Existing means the dying player keeps their current team.
Closest Enemy means the dying player turns into the closest person on another team.
Random Enemy means the dying player randomly changes to another player's team.
The default value is Closest Enemy.

name: Monarch
description: A folder containing the options for the monarch gamemode, used when it is selected.

elements.text: Controls if the monarchs of each team are forced to have a set amount of lives.
This is to standardize monarchs, and to allow instant death situations.
When Disabled the monarch uses the live number of their personal extra lives setting.
When Enabled, you can change the Extra Lives option to change the number of lives monarchs have.
The default value for Override Monarch Lives is Enabled.
Values for Extra Lives may be between 0L to 1000000L. The default value is 0L.
Controls how long tanks take to revive in the monarch gamemode.
Reviving takes extra lives, which for both monarchs and peasants.
After reviving, tanks spawn in at a random location on the map.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s.
Controls how long tanks must be the last standing to earn a point in monarch gamemode.
After all other teams / tanks are eliminated, this timer starts.
If no players are alive at the end of the timer, the round ends in a draw. Otherwise, each player on the surviving team gets a point.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 2s to 5s.
Controls who can see / identify the monarch of a team.
Everyone lets all players see the monarchs of all teams.
Enemies Only only lets players see the monarchs of teams that are not their own.
Team Only only lets you see your own team's monarch.
Self Only only lets monarchs know who they are. All other players do not know who the monarch is.
None does not let the monarchs know who they are, nor any other players.
Note that monarchs are identified by their name color, yellow for your monarch and purple for enemy monarchs.
You may optionally change monarch's base border color to purple and yellow as well.
The default value is Everyone.
Controls the maximum distance away from the monarch tanks can spawn.
When set to 0ψ, tanks spawn completely randomly like normal.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 10000ψ.

name: King of the Hill
description: A folder containing the options for the king of the hill gamemode, used when it is selected.

elements.name: King of the Hill Countdown Timer
King of the Hill First Crown Assignment
King of the Hill Shuffle Players On Steal
King of the Hill Kill Old King
King of the Hill Team Owns Crown
King of the Hill Arrow to Crown

name: King of the Hill Countdown Timer

elements.text: Controls how long a tank must consecutively hold the crown to win the round.
Whenever the crown is stolen, this timer restarts.
If the timer ends, whoever holds the crown earns the point for the round.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 15s.

name: King of the Hill First Crown Assignment

elements.text: Controls who originally gets the crown to start the round.
First Killer means no one spawns with the crown, but instead the person who gets the first kill earns it.
Random Player means when the round starts, a random player gets the crown.
Losing Player means when the round starts, the player with the least overall points gets the crown.
The default value is First Killer.

name: King of the Hill Shuffle Players On Steal

elements.text: Controls if stealing the crown instantly shuffles the players.
When Enabled, killing the crown bearer teleports all players to random locations on the map.
When Disabled, killing the crown bearer simply gives you the crown, and only teleports the player you killed.
The default value is Disabled.

name: King of the Hill Kill Old King

elements.text: Controls if stealing the crown turns the old crown bearer into a ghost.
When Enabled, killing the crown bearer turns them into a ghost until the crown is stolen again.
If the crown is stolen again, they become the new ghost and the existing ghost will be revived and spawned in.
When Disabled, killing the crown bearer simply teleports them away and steals their crown.
The default value is Disabled.

name: King of the Hill Team Owns Crown

elements.text: Controls if killing a teammate of the crown bearer also steals the crown.
When Enabled, killing someone on the same team as the player who owns the crown steals the crown for your team.
If the old bearer dies is Enabled, only the team member who was killed turns into a ghost.
When Disabled, you must kill the specific crown bearer in order to steal the crown.
The default value is Enabled.

name: King of the Hill Path to Crown

elements.text: Controls if all players get a line leading to the current crown bearer.
When Enabled, a line will always lead to the crown bearer's location.
When Disabled, you do not get a line, however you can still identify the crown bearer by their symbol.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Teams and Players
description: A folder containing how teams and players function.

elements.text: Controls how teams are made, and the numbers of players assigned to teams.
The Overflow method fills teams until they reach a player limit.
Once the player limit is reached on a team, a new team is made and players join it until the process repeats.
If a gap is made in a team from a player leaving, new players will fill gaps before a new team is made.
Max Players controls the player limit before a new team is made in Overflow mode.
The Group method creates a set amount of teams with no player limit, and new players are distributed among these teams.
Total Teams controls the amount of teams players will be sorted into in Group mode.
You can change if players are distributed randomly or evenly between teams using Distribution Type.
The default value is Overflow, with 1 player per team to make a FFA.
Controls if all tanks on a team share a common color.
When Enabled, all tanks on a team spawn in as the color of a random tank on the team.
Tanks with their color set to random do not count towards this if tanks with specific colors exist.
When Disabled, everyone on a team keeps their own color, but can still be identified by a green name.
The default is Enabled.
Controls the maximum amount of people allowed to join the lobby.
The lobby will not appear when full, and players attempting to join will fail.
Values may be between 1P to 100P. The default value is 20P.

name: Map Generation
description: A folder containing the info for creating a map.

elements.text: Controls the size of map tiles.
Map tiles spawn in proportion to the map dimensions, with each tile being this size.
You may also change the width of walls with respect to tiles when mazes are generated.
Values may be between 1ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 800ψ.
Controls how many map tiles spawn on each axis.
You can set how many tiles spawn on both the x and y axis.
Values may be between 1τ to 1000000τ. The default value for both is 3τ to 8τ.

name: Maze Generation
description: A folder containing the info for spawning mazes.

elements.text: Controls if the server attempts to spawn a maze while in game.
When Enabled, a maze is created using the tile dimensions of the map, and the other generative settings.
When Disabled, no maze is created at all.
The default is Enabled.
Controls what percentage of the map's tiles cannot be accessed.
For example, 0% means the maze is square and all parts can be accessed. 100% means the entire maze is a single block.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 0% to 20%.
Controls what percentage of walls are removed from the pure maze.
When spawned, all mazes are minimally cleared, such that adding a wall anywhere would render a section of maze unreachable.
From this minimally cleared state, this percentage of inner walls will then be removed.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 0% to 20%.
Controls how long hallways are cut from the maze.
While random, larger numbers generally mean longer hallways in closed maps.
Values may be between 0τ to 100τ. The default value is 1τ.
Controls the set of possible custom mazes, and their spawn rates.
To add walls or close tiles, click them. To remove them, either right click or delete from the menu.
You may set the rate custom maps spawn compared to regular generated maps.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 0%.

name: Wall Types
description: A folder containing all the wall types in your loadout.

name: Wall Types All
description: A folder containing all the wall type settings.

elements.text: Controls the name of the wall type.
This is only visible in the editor, and helps to distinguish between different wall types.
Controls how likely this wall type is to spawn in comparison to other wall types.
For example, say the spawn chances of Wall A, B, and C are respectively 5ω, 10ω, and 40ω.
In this case Wall A spawns 10% of the time, B spawns 20% of the time, and C spawns 80% of the time.
Values may be between 0ω to 1000000ω. The default value is 100ω.
Controls the color of the wall.
Note that the color you see may be different from others, depending on your selected theme.
There are 55 possible colors, or random chooses a random one each time the wall spawns.
Controls the thickness of the wall.
Measured in a percentage of the standard wall thickness, set under Map Tile Size.
Note values above 100% may spawn out of bounds, which causes walls with mass to rebound into the map.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value is 100%.
Controls how much velocity objects that hit the wall lose.
A value of 100% means collisions are perfectly elastic, 0% means all momentum is lost when touching the wall.
Bullets hitting the wall lose velocity based on this value before any on-collide effects occur.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value is 100%.
Controls how much error is added to the reflection of objects off the wall.
A value of 0° means reflections are perfect, 360° means things bouncing off the wall move in a completely random direction.
For example, a bullet hitting a 10° roughness wall at 0° will reflect off between 175° to 185° if it would otherwise reflect at 180°.
Values may be between 0° to 180°. The default value is 0°.
Controls how much damage the wall does to objects touching it every second.
Note this damage bypasses any resistance the object has.
You may set the damage per bounce for bullets, and the DPS for tank collisions separately.
Tank Damage is applied every time a tank hits the wall, and Bullet Damage is the same for bullets.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 0hp.
Controls if the wall has a hitbox.
When Enabled, the wall collides with objects like normal.
When Disabled, while the wall appears to exist, it does not collide with or damage any objects.
You may choose to have the wall visually remove itself upon an unsuccessful collision when Disabled.
If the wall does not remove itself on collisions, it will remain visually despite still not existing.
The default value is Enabled.
Controls if the wall casts a shadow.
When Enabled, the wall will cast shadows for lights that cannot pierce shadows.
When Disabled, the wall will never cast a shadow.
The default value is Enabled.
Controls how transparent the wall is.
A value of 0% means the wall is completely invisible, 100% means it is completely visible.
The opacity of the wall affects its shadow if it casts one, such that a 20% opaque wall casts a 20% opaque shadow.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 100%.
Controls how transparent the wall is when collided with by an object.
Whenever a bullet, tank, or box collides with this wall, its opacity is set to this number.
You can control how long it takes to fade in.
A fade in value of 0s means the wall will remain at the collision opacity permanently when hit.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 100%.
Controls the mass of the wall.
The mass of the wall controls how easy or difficult it is to push.
A value of 0 makes the wall an immovable object.
Values may be between 0g to 1000000g. The default value is 0g.
Controls where the wall type can spawn when used for maze walls.
Everywhere means the wall can spawn in any place.
Edges Only means the wall can only spawn on tiles touching a border.
Center Only means the wall can only spawn on the inner tiles of the maze.
The default value is Everything.
Controls how different ids interact with the wall.
Ignore IDs means any bullet with a matching id ignores the wall.
Die To IDs means any bullet with a matching id will destroy the wall.
Kill With IDs means any bullet with a matching id will die when hitting the wall.
To set the ids of bullets, go to the Weapon Wall Collision Type.
The default value is No Ids for both.

name: Waiting Room Generation
description: A folder containing settings for how the waiting room works

elements.text: Controls the dimensions of the waiting room.
The waiting room uses the same tile size as in game, but you can make it larger or smaller dimensionally.
Values may be between 0τ to 100τ. The default value for x and y is 4τ.
Controls if the waiting room spawns a maze.
When Enabled a maze is spawned, when Disabled no maze spawns.
The default value is Enabled.
Controls what happens when people die in the waiting room.
Teleport sends players to a random location on the map and revives them if they would die.
Ignore cancels instantly revives the player in their current location.
Ghost turns the player into a temporary ghost and teleports them to a random spot on the map.
You can change how long it takes the ghost to revive, 0s means they do not revive until a lobby refresh.
The default value is Ghost, with 5s respawn.

name: Ghost Permissions
description: A folder containing settings for what ghosts can or cannot do.

elements.text: Controls what living players can see ghosts.
None only lets ghosts see other ghosts.
Killer Only only lets your tank's killer see your ghost.
Team Only only lets players on the same team see your ghost.
Everyone lets all players see ghosts.
Touching lets any player intersecting with a ghost see it.
The default value is None.
Controls what dead player's cameras lock to.
Note that spectating tanks do not form a ghost but instead track a player.
Therefore, turning on spectation makes Ghost Visibility and Secondary Battles obsolete.
No Spectate makes ghost's cameras centered on their own tank, like normal.
Spectate Killer lets the ghost see from their killer's eyes.
Spectate Random lets the ghost see from a random tank's eyes.
Spectate Teammate lets the ghost see from a random teammates's eyes, if one exists. Otherwise, a random tank is spectated.
The default value is No Spectate.

name: Powerup Server Settings
description: A folder containing settings for how powerups spawn overall.

elements.text: Controls the maximum amount of powerups able to be spawned at once.
Once a powerup is despawned or deprecated, it deincrements the counter and another powerup can spawn.
Values may be between 0ζ to 1000ζ. The default value is 4ζ.
Controls the time taken between powerup spawns.
For example, a 3s to 5s timer will cause a random powerup to spawn in random 3s to 5s intervals.
Note that the first powerup to spawn also waits for this timer, and does not spawn instantly.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 3s to 8s.

name: Miscellaneous Server
description: A folder containing settings for the game as a whole that didn't fit into other categories.

elements.text: Controls what happens when two tanks collide.
Damage means tanks damage each other if not on the same team. If on the same team, the tanks ignore each other.
Ignore means tanks do not collide with each other.
Solid means tanks act as solid objects and cannot be passed through by other tanks.
The default value is Damage.
Controls when and if other players can see a tank's health bars and name.
Always Visible means a tank's health bar and name will always appear to all players.
Never Visible means other players can never see a tank's display name or health bar.
Only Fully Visible means players cannot see names or healthbars until the center of the tank is fully within their vision.
This can prevent seeing tanks through walls by their name or healthbar.
The default value is Only Fully Visible.

name: Powerups
description: A folder containing all the powerups in your loadout.

name: Powerup All
description: A folder containing all the powerup settings.

name: Weapon Metadata and Exports
description: A folder containing all the powerup settings that do not directly affect gameplay.

elements.text: The displayed name of the weapon.
Displayed in game when viewing held powerups in the backpack, so it should be simple but clear cut.
Max length of 32 characters
Pressing the Export Powerup button will download a text file.
Save this file to automatically import your powerup to any loadout.
To Import, create a new powerup and upload the text file after selecting the 'Import' option
In case you are having issues downloading, you can also copy the raw data to your clipboard, and paste it into a text file.
After pasting the data in, the text file can be imported like normal.

name: Weapon Graphics
description: A folder containing settings for how the bullet and its bubble look.

elements.text: Controls the appearance of the tank when this powerup is equipped.
You can use the editor to directly add or remove shapes, or use the built in options.
Controls the appearance of the powerup's bubble.
You can use the editor to directly add or remove shapes, or use the built in options.

You may also choose how large the powerup bubbles that spawn are

.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 100ψ.
Controls the appearance of the tank when this powerup is equipped.
You can use the editor to directly add or remove shapes, or use the built in options.
Controls the minimum opacity of the weapon's bullets for those safe from them.
For example, when set to 0, you and your team see the bullet the same way opponents do.
If set to 20 and friendly fire is disabled, you and your team will see:
A 0% opacity bullet at 20% opacity, a 50% opacity bullet at 60% opacity, and a 100% opacity bullet at 100% opacity.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 0%.
Controls the fade effect on this bullet to those safe from it.
This is to help players focus on threats, while still letting them track their own bullets.
If this bullet is capable of harming a tank, they will see it in full opacity.
This acts as a percentage of the default opacity, for example a value of 50% will make a 50% opacity safe bullet appear 25% opaque.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 20%.
Controls what tanks are able to see invisible bullets.
If you are able to see an invisible bullet, the User Min Opacity is used instead of 0%.
For example, a min opacity of 20% means a 50% opacity bullet will appear 60% opaque to those who can see it.
None means that everyone sees the bullet at its normal opacity.
Self means the person who fired the bullet can see it when invisible, but all other tanks cannot.
Teammates means anyone on the same team as the bullet can see it when invisible.
The default value is Self.

name: Bullet Trails
description: A folder containing settings for how the bullet makes trails.

elements.text: Controls if the bullet leaves behind a trail as it travels.
When Enabled, bullets leave behind a trail. When Disabled, they do not.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the length of trails.
A trail will follow the bullet based on where it was for an amount of time in seconds based on this.
A value of 0 means the trail is permanent.
Optionally, you can also decrease the marking interval which can help save memory when rendering lots of trails.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 0s.
Controls the color, fading, and size of trails.
The color of the trail defaults to the bullet's color is not overriden, but you may force it to a specific color.
When fading is Enabled, a trail will fade as it gets older, with newer trail being the most visible.
Finally, you may change the size of the trail in percentage of the bullet's size.

name: Weapon Initialization
description: A folder containing settings for how bullets initially act and are set up.

name: Weapon Spawning
description: A folder containing settings for how powerups and their bubbles spawn.

elements.text: Controls if the bullet creates bubbles or not.
When Enabled, bubbles appear that let tanks collect the powerup in game.
When Disabled, the powerup can be used as a multifire attachment, or a particle configuration.
The default value is Enabled.
Controls if the powerup is treated as a default powerup.
When Enabled, the powerup will have the following changes:
The weapon will only have 1 round.
When a bullet is destroyed, the default powerup will reload a bullet to match.
The weapon will not be removed when out of ammo, instead you must wait until a bullet despawns.
In summary, the weapon becomes permanent and uses its shots per round as the max bullets it can have out at once.
When Disabled, the powerup functions like normal.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the chance of this spawning, compared to other powerups.
Whenever a powerup would attempt to spawn, the type of powerup to spawn is chosen based on priority.
For example, if powerup A has a priority of 5ω, and B has a priority of 15ω, A will spawn 1/4 times and B will spawn 3/4 times.
Values may be between 0ω to 1000000ω. The default value is 100ω.
Controls the chance of this powerup having a fake bubble spawn.
When this powerup is selected to spawn, this probability decides if it creates a fake bubble or not.
Fake bubbles act like regular powerup bubbles, except when a tank attempts to collect them they disappear without giving their powerup.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 0%.
Controls the max amount of times a powerup can spawn a bubble.
When set to 0, the powerup can make infinite bubbles.
Removed bubbles still count towards the max spawns.
Values may be between 0ζ to 1000000ζ. The default value is 0ζ.
Controls how long the powerup bubble lasts before despawning.
When Enabled, the powerup despawns on a timer. When Disabled, bubbles last until collected.
If the timer finishes without the powerup being collected, it is removed from the game.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is Disabled.
Controls if the powerup is added to the initial loadout of the tank.
When Enabled, you can also set a probability of it spawning in at the start of each round.
If more powerups would start equipped than available slots, you may also set a priority to spawn at.
When Disabled, it must be collected to be found.
Spawn Chance values may be between 0% to 100%. The default is Disabled.

name: Weapon Firing
description: A folder for how the weapon fires, when it can fire, and how it affects the tank upon firing.

elements.text: Controls how long tanks must wait in between individual shots for the round.
Every shot detracts from this number, and once the round runs out a new round will be loaded.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 1s.
Controls how long tanks must wait when reloading a round.
When the max shots are reached on a round, this is the time before the next round can be loaded.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 1s.
Controls how many shots are fired for every round in the weapon.
For example, a weapon with 2 rounds and 3 shots per round will fire 6 total bullets.
Values may be between 1δ to 1000000δ. The default is 3δ.
Controls how many rounds of shots the weapon has before removal.
Once all shots are used in a round, the round is reloaded. If no rounds remain, the weapon is considered empty.
Values may be between 1R to 1000000R. The default is 1R.
Controls how many bullets are expelled with a single fire of the weapon.
Unless Precompute Shot attributes is on, randomization on each bullet will be different.
If Count Per Bullet is Enabled, each individual bullet will detract from your shot count, instead of each fire only detracting once.
Values may be between 1b to 1000000b. The default is 1b.
Controls the directional offset of bullets.
For example, when 0° bullets are fired outward from the tank.
If set to -180° or 180°, bullets will instead shoot backwards into the tank.
-90° is the counterclockwise (left) angle to your barrel, and 90° is the clockwise (right) angle.
Values may be between -180° to 180°. The default is 0°.
Controls the angle from the center of the tank bullets are ejected from.
For example, when 0° bullets will fire out the front of the tank.
If set to -180° or 180°, bullets will instead fire out the back of the tank.
-90° is the counterclockwise (left) angle to your front, and 90° is the clockwise (right) angle.
Values are added to the Directional Offset of a bullet upon firing,
such that a -30° to 30° degree arc will still have 60° inaccuracy, no matter what the firing location is of the weapon
You may also choose to disconnect the fire location with the initial direction of the bullet.
Values may be between -180° to 180°. The default is 0°.
Controls the recoil on the tank when firing this weapon.
Tank mass is taken into account during recoil, such that a tank with 2g mass is pushed half as much as a tank with 1g mass.
Values are applied in Newtons, as an instantaneous acceleration force.
For example, firing a 100N recoil bullet will have the same impulse as getting hit by a 100g tank.
This would result in an average sized push. Higher values will result in more and more extreme forces applied when firing.
Values may be between 0N to 1000000N. The default is 0N.
Controls the time the tank is frozen before and after firing the weapon.
When in animation lock, all of the tank's functions are temporarily removed.
Pre-Fire Animation Lock locks your tank before a bullet is fired.
Dying during pre-fire will remove the lock, but cancel the firing and still use a shot.
Post-Fire Animation Lock occurs after the bullet is already shot from the tank.
Values may be between 0N to 1000000N. The default is 0N.
Controls how far the bullet is spawned from the tank when firing.
Measured in percentage of the tank's size, with 0% spawning in the center of the tank and 100% spawning directly outside the tank.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default is 100%.
Controls if the powerup is removed on a timer, and when and how it is removed.
No Timer is Default and does not place a deprecation timer on the weapon.
Pickup Timer starts the timer as soon as the weapon is collected, and removes it when the timer expires.
Fire Timer starts the timer as soon as the weapon is first used, and removes it when the timer expires.
The default is No Timer.
Controls if random values are precomputed and locked for rounds and shots.
For example, if shot values are precomputed all bullets in a single shot will have the same speed, damage, mass, ect.
If round values are precomputed, all shots in a round will have the same reload, bullets per shot, ammo, ect.
The default is Disabled for both.
Controls if powerup recovers while being kept in your inventory.
When Enabled, powerups in your inventory recover.
When Disabled, if not currently equipped this powerup will not reload.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if powerup is deleted when all ammo is used, or if it still requires an inventory slot.
When Enabled, the powerup will automatically delete itself when the last round is used.
When Disabled, the powerup may only be removed via deprecation or dropping.
The default value is Enabled.
Controls if powerup instantly uses a shot when collected.
When Enabled, the powerup will automatically take a shot. This will function as if the player pressed their fire button.
When Disabled, the powerup does not automatically fire on pickup.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the powerup forces you to use it before using other powerups.
When Enabled, you cannot select a weapon with no force equip or with lower priority while this is in your inventory.
When Disabled, you may freely choose other weapons to equip instead of this.
Weapons with the same priority may be chosen between, but you must use weapons from highest priority to lowest.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the bullets die when the person who fired them dies.
When Enabled, if the firing tank dies (extra lives do not count), the bullets will be removed without triggering death events.
When Disabled, bullets will last and can kill players even after their parent dies.
The default value is Disabled.

name: Weapon Base Attributes
description: A folder for the intrinsic initial properties of the bullets

elements.text: Controls the speed of the fired bullets, in percentages of the firing tank's speed.
If you want to instead to treat the value as the static unit ψ, you may override the base.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default is 120%.
Controls the rotational speed of bullets, in degrees of directional change per second.
Note this is a how fast they appear to spin, visually and for direction.
Velocity change with respect to direction is only affected by the Rotation Changing setting.
Positive Values spin clockwise, negative values spin counterclockwise.
You may also optionally lock bullet angles, causing them to not change angle when bouncing but only from angular speed.
Values may be between -1000000°/s to 1000000°/s. The default is 0°/s.
Controls the radius of bullets fired by the weapon, in percentages of the firing tank's size.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default is 30%.
Controls the opacity of bullets fired by the weapon.
If Sync Tank Opacity is Enabled, bullets also multiply by their firing tank's opacity.
Note Sync Tank means this also uses the firing bullet's opacity, when shot as a fragment or release event.
For example, if the tank is 80% opaque, a Synced bullet fired with 50% opacity will spawn 40% opaque.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default is 100%.
Controls the speed lost by fired bullets when they bounce.
Measured in percentage of retained velocity, such that 100% means no speed is lost bouncing and 0% means the bullet instantly stops when bouncing.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default is 100%.
Controls the angle of inaccuracy when bullets bounce.
Measured in the total degree arc.
For example a bullet colliding at 180° with 10° roughness will reflect between -5° and 5°.
Values may be between 0° to 180°. The default is 0°.
Controls the health pool of bullets fired from the weapon.
Damage dealt over the bullet's resistance is taken out of the bullet's health.
When a bullet reaches 0hp, it is destroyed and the destruction frag event is triggered.
When health is set to 0hp, the bullet has infinite health and can only die to Self-Destruction or range.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default is 100hp.
Controls the damage resistance of bullets fired from the weapon.
Damage dealt to a bullet first has the damage resist subtracted from it.
For example, a bullet with resist 10hp will take 2hp damage from a 12hp damage source, and take no damage from 10hp damage sources or lower.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default is 0hp.
Controls who can be damaged or harmed from bullets of the weapon.
All means no one is safe from the bullets.
Others means the firing player cannot hurt themselves, but can hurt enemies and their own teammates.
Exclude Team means the firing player cannot hurt themselves or anyone on the same team.
Exclude Team Except Self means the firing tank can hurt themselves, but not others on their team.
Only Team means the firing tank can only hit themselves and other players on the same team.
None means the bullet cannot hit tanks. This can be useful for projectiles meant only to destroy other bullets or walls.
The default is All.
Controls the lifetime of bullets fired by this weapon.
After the range on a bullet expires, it is destroyed and the Range Death frag event triggers.
If range is set to 0s, the bullet does not die of range and can only be destroyed via Self-Destruction or damage.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 10s.
Controls the mass of bullets fired by this weapon.
The mass of a bullet generally only effects its collisions with blocks and other bullets.
If physical collisions in Enabled, this also effect's its momentum when colliding with tanks however.
Values may be between 0.01g to 1000000g. The default is 10g.
Controls if the bullets fired from the weapon cast shadows in player's vision.
The opacity of a bullet influences the shadow, such that a 20% opaque bullet casts a 20% opaque shadow.
All players see the casted shadow, no matter the friendly fire setting of the bullet.
When Enabled a shadow is cast, when Disabled the bullet will not have a shadow.
The default is Disabled.

name: Weapon Adjustments
description: A folder for how bullets and their attributes change over time

name: Bullet Rotation Changes
description: A folder for how bullets rotate over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their angulr velocity.
When Enabled, bullets change their angular velocity when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their direction when in motion.
Optionally, you may also cause the change to affect the visual angle, rather than the momentum of the bullet.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how quickly / by how much bullets change their rotation speed when enabled.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
Positive numbers mean clockwise velocity, negative numbers are counterclockwise.
All three are off by default.
Controls when the bullet's angular acceleration is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its rotational acceleration.
Effect Duration controls how long the angular velocity change takes after the delay triggers.
For example, a bullet that accelerates on bounce with delay 2s and duration 8s will only accelerate from 2s-10s after being fired.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's angular velocity change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their angular velocity changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
For example, if the change per second is set from 0°/s to 10°/s, when locked a bullet may for example choose 2°/s.
This would result in the bullet always changing rotational velocity by 2°/s for its entire life.
If disabled, it will instead change acceleration to different rates every tick, to a random value between 0°/s and 10°/s.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Velocity Change
description: A folder for how bullets change velocity over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their velocity.
When Enabled, bullets can change velocity when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their velocity unless acted on by another force.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how much bullet change their velocity when enabled.
Values are measured in percentages of the tank's speed when firing the bullet.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the minimum and maximum values for the bullet's velocity.
Only applies when Velocity Changes are Enabled.
The Minimum Speed sets the lowest angular velocity the bullet can have while speed changing is active.
The Maximum Speed sets the highest angular velocity the bullet can have while speed changing is active.
These are limits for any direction of motion, direction does not matter.
If values would exceed the min or max, they are instead clamped to the min or max they exceeded.
Values are measured in percentages of the tank's speed when firing the bullet.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default is from 0% to 1000000%.
Controls when the bullet's acceleration is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its acceleration.
Effect Duration controls how long the velocity change takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's velocity change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their velocity changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Targeting
description: A folder for how bullets heat-seek targets

elements.text: Controls if bullets will target nearby players after a certain period.
When Enabled, bullets will change their direction in order to seek out a target.
When Disabled, bullets will not target players.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how long targeted bullets take to readjust their flight plan.
Once per interval, a bullet will recalibrate the most effective direction to hit their target, and will move that way.
If set to 0s, bullets will constantly target the best way towards their target. Note that the target can change every interval, if they become closest.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0.5s.
Controls how steeply bullets curve towards their target every second.
For example, a value of 50%/s means that if a bullet is moving 0° with a target at 100°, after one second the will will be facing 50°.
The update interval does not affect this, although larger intervals will naturally result in more sudden movements.
Values may be between 0%/s to 100%/s. The default is 90%/s.
Controls the angle of inaccuracy the bullet targets with every interval.
For example, a 10° inaccuracy means the bullet will face an extra 10° clockwise from its target when seeking.
A random inaccuracy in the interval is chosen every interval it tracks a target.
Values may be between -360° to 360°. The default is 0°.
Controls the delay and duration of the targeting effect on the bullet.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its targeting.
Effect Duration controls how long the bullet will target tanks after the delay.
After the duration is finished, the bullet returns to following a straight path instead of targeting people.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s delay with 10s duration.
Controls what targets targeting bullets can latch onto.
Allow Targeting Self controls if the bullet is able to target the person who fired it.
Allow Targeting Team controls if the bullet is able to target other players on the same team as the person who fired it.
Allow Targeting Bullets means the bullet can target other bullets.
The default value is Enabled for Targeting Self and Team, and Disabled for Targeting Bullets.
Controls how the targeting pathfinding works.
Absolute Target means the bullet will always move directly towards the closest target in a straight line, ignoring obstacles.
Find Closest Absolute Target means the bullet will target the player in the smallest straight line distance, attempting to pathfind around walls.
The default value is Find Closest Absolute Target.
Controls if each bullet's targeting is locked to its initial values, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have a permanent interval and interpolation.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their targeting attributes every seeking interval.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Size Change
description: A folder for how bullets change size over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their size.
When Enabled, bullets can change size when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their size after being fired.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how quickly / by how much bullets change their size when enabled.
Values are measured in percentages of the tank's size when firing the bullet.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
Note that a size of 0 will result in the bullet performing a destruction type death.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the minimum and maximum values for the bullet's size.
Only applies when Size Changes are Enabled.
The Minimum Size sets the smallest size the bullet can have while size changing is active.
The Maximum Size sets the largest size the bullet can have while size changing is active.
If values would exceed the min or max, they are instead clamped to the min or max they exceeded.
Values are measured in percentages of the tank's size when firing the bullet.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default is from 0% to 1000000%.
Controls when the bullet's size change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its size changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the size changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's size change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their size changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Range Change
description: A folder for how bullets change range over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their range.
When Enabled, bullets can change their range when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their range after being fired (and lose it over time as normal).
The default is Disabled.
Controls how quickly / by how much bullets change their size when enabled.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
Note that a range of 0 will result in the bullet performing a range type death like normal.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the maximum value for the bullet's range.
Only applies when Range Changes are Enabled.
The Maximum Range sets the largest range the bullet can have while range changing is active.
If values would exceed the max, they are instead clamped to the max instead.
If the bullet would hit 0 range from a range change, it dies from range like normal.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 600s.
Controls when the bullet's range change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its range changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the range changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's range change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their range changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
For example, if the change per second is set from 0s to 10s, when locked a bullet may for example choose 3s.
This would result in the bullet always changing range by 3s for its entire life.
If disabled, it will instead change the range change every tick, to a random value between 0s and 3s.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Opacity Change
description: A folder for how bullets change opacity over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their opacity.
When Enabled, bullets can change their opacity when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their opacity after being fired.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how quickly / by how much bullets change their opacity when enabled.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the maximum value for the bullet's opacity.
Only applies when Opacity Changes are Enabled.
The Minimum Opacity sets the lowest visiblity the bullet can have while opacity changing is active.
The Maximum Opacity sets the highest visibility the bullet can have while opacity changing is active.
If values would exceed the min or max, they are instead clamped to the min or max they exceeded.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default is from 0% to 100%.
Controls when the bullet's opacity change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its opacity changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the opacity changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's opacity change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their opacity changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Health Change
description: A folder for how bullets change health over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their health.
When Enabled, bullets can change their health when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their health after being fired (losing it when colliding like normal).
The default is Disabled.
Controls how quickly / by how much bullets change their health when enabled.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
Note that if health falls at or below 0, the bullet dies a destruction death like normal.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the maximum value for the bullet's health.
Only applies when Health Changes are Enabled.
Health bars also use this is the max health for health bars when Health Changes are enabled.
The Maximum Health sets the highest health the bullet can have while health changing is active.
If values would exceed the max, they are instead clamped to the max.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default is 1000000hp.
Controls when the bullet's health change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its health changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the health changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's health change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their health changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Resist Change
description: A folder for how bullets change damage resist over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their damage resist.
When Enabled, bullets can change their damage resist when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their damage resist after being fired.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how quickly / by how much bullets change their damage resistance when enabled.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the maximum value for the bullet's damage resist.
Only applies when Damage Resist Changes are Enabled.
The Maximum Resist sets the highest damage resist the bullet can have while damage resist changing is active.
The Minimum Resist sets the lowest damage resist the bullet can have while damage resist changing is active.
If values would exceed the min or max, they are instead clamped to the cap they exceede.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default is 1000000hp.
Controls when the bullet's damage resist change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its damage resist changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the damage resist changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's damage resist change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their damage resist changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Bubble Change
description: A folder for how bullets change bubble over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their bubble.
When Enabled, bullets can change their bubble when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their bubble after being fired.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how much bullet change their light bubble's size when enabled.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the maximum value for the bullet's bubble.
Only applies when Bubble Changes are Enabled.
The Maximum Bubble sets the highest bubble the bullet can have while bubble changing is active.
The Minimum Bubble sets the lowest bubble the bullet can have while bubble changing is active.
If values would exceed the min or max, they are instead clamped to the min or max they exceeded.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default is 1000000ψ.
Controls when the bullet's bubble change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its bubble changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the bubble changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's bubble change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their bubble changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Bullet Bubble Opacity Change
description: A folder for how bullets change bubble opacity over time

elements.text: Controls if bullets dynamically change their bubble opacity.
When Enabled, bullets can change their bubble opacity when active based on the other settings in this file.
When Disabled, bullets maintain their bubble opacity after being fired.
The default is Disabled.
Controls how much bullet change their light bubble's size when enabled.
Each event has an additive and multiplicative value.
Additive values are applied before multiplication.
There are three events that can trigger a change, and each may be individually set.
Change Per Bounce applies the change once every bounce while active.
Change Per Second applies the change smoothly over time, with the set change cumulatively happening every second while active.
Change Per Collision applies the change whenever the bullet destroys another tank or bullet.
All three are off by default.
Controls the maximum value for the bullet's bubble opacity.
Only applies when Bubble Opacity Changes are Enabled.
The Maximum Bubble Opacity sets the highest bubble opacity the bullet can have while bubble opacity changing is active.
The Minimum Bubble Opacity sets the lowest bubble opacity the bullet can have while bubble opacity changing is active.
If values would exceed the min or max, they are instead clamped to the min or max they exceeded.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default is from 0% to 100%.
Controls when the bullet's bubble opacity change is active.
Effect Delay controls how long until after the bullet is fired it waits to activate its bubble opacity changing.
Effect Duration controls how long the bubble opacity changing takes after the delay triggers.
A duration value of 0s will result in an infinite duration after the delay.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default is 0s for both.
Controls if each bullet's bubble opacity change is locked to a single value, or if it can vary.
When Enabled, each bullet will have one value their bubble opacity changes by for each event.
When Disabled, each bullet will vary their changes when adjustments are randomized.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Weapon Interactions
description: A folder for how bullets interact with various other objects and tanks

name: Bullet Collisions
description: A folder for controling if/how bullets react with objects

elements.text: Controls how bullet from the weapon collide with tanks.
Note that friendly fire can result in the bullets and certain tanks ignoring each other, ignoring this setting.
Damage causes bullets to deal their health in damage to any tank they hit.
Ignore causes bullets to ignore tanks in their collisions.
The default value is Damage.
Controls how bullet from the weapon collide with other bullets.
If two bullet with different collision types collide, the one with the highest priority is used.
An important note is that bullets from the same shot will always ignore each other.
This prevents them doing weird stuff when fired and they all overlap.
Ignore causes bullets to ignore other bullets in their collisions.
Damage causes bullets to deal their health in damage to other bullets.
Bounce causes bullets to bounce off other bullets without dealing damage.
The Collision Type is separated, and can be different for bullets on the same team and those on different teams.
The default value is Ignore for both.
Priority values may be between 0ω to 1000000ω. The default value is 100ω.
Controls how bullet from the weapon collide with walls.
Bounce causes bullets to bounce off walls like normal.
Ignore causes bullets to pass through walls.
You may also give the bullet wall interaction ids, which allows it to interact with specific wall types.
The default value is Bounce.
Controls if bullets bounce, die, or ignore the borders of the map.
Die To Borders means when hitting the map boundary, bullets die a self-destruction type death.
Ignore Borders means that bullets can go outside the map.
Bounce On Borders means bullets will be rebounded when hitting the map border.
The default value is Die To Borders.
Controls if bullets fired from the weapon destroy walls they collide with.
When Enabled, bullets destroy walls they collide with.
When Disabled, they do not destroy them.
A bullet that destroys a wall will still follow its Bounce or Ignore property.
Destroyed walls still count towards the Die On Walls counter.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls how many tanks bullets can collide with before they are destroyed.
When Enabled, bullets can only hit the specified amount of tanks before dying.
Bullets who die from this setting trigger the destruction type death as if they ran out of health.
Tanks that are ignore do not count towards this counter.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls how many other bullets bullets can collide with before they are destroyed.
When Enabled, bullets can only hit the specified amount of bullets before dying.
Bullets who die from this setting trigger the destruction type death as if they ran out of health.
Bullets that are ignore do not count towards this counter.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls how many walls bullets can collide with before they are destroyed.
When Enabled, bullets can only hit the specified amount of walls before dying.
Bullets who die from this setting trigger the destruction type death as if they ran out of health.
Walls that are ignore do not count towards this counter.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the maximum amount of times a bullet can collide with a tank.
For example, if set to 2h, the bullet will collide twice, then become unable to hit the tank again.
This does not mean the bullet cannot hit other tanks, just that the same tank cannot then be hit again.
The bullet must leave and re-enter the tank's hitbox for a new collision to be counted.
A value of 0 means the bullet will instantly deal its damage, resulting in the guarenteed death of either the bullet or tank.
Note that when a bullet is out of collisions with a tank, the tank sees Safe Fading since it can no longer be hit by it.
You may set the maximum amount of damage done per single collision as well.
The default value is 0.
Controls if bullets can physically push tanks.
WARNING: this setting may cause other settings that mess with the bullet's trajectory to not work when enabled.
When Enabled, bullets act like physical objects when interacting with tanks, and cannot damage them through normal means.
When Disabled, bullets do cannot physically interact, and either damage or ignore tanks.
The force of the impact is affected by both the bullet and tank's mass.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if bullets deal no collision damage to objects.
When Enabled, bullets cannot deal or recieve physical damage from tank or bullet collisions.
When Disabled, bullets deal damage like normal.
Effects are still applied, even if no damage is done.
Optionally, you can have bullets collide every frame with objects inside them.
The default value is Disabled.

name: Bullet Freezing
description: A folder for controling the freeze interaction on bullets

elements.text: Controls if bullets can instill the freeze effect.
When Enabled, bullets can freeze valid targets.
When Disabled, bullets will not cause the freeze status condition.
Freeze can be Enabled for Tanks and/or Bullets it hits.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the speed multiplier applied to frozen objects.
This is expressed a percentage of the speed they would otherwise be going.
For example, a freeze effect of 20% will make a tank moving at 10ψ/s move at 2ψ/s.
The Initial and Final freeze speeds are smoothly transitioned between over the duration of the freeze.
For example, a 10s duration from 0% to 100% will fully stop the player at first, and gradually fade over 10 seconds.
Values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value is from 50% to 100%.
Controls how long the applied freeze status effect lasts.
If a higher or equal priority freeze is applied without stacking, the status effect timer will be reset to the new freeze's duration.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s.
