Controls if the freeze is able to pair with other freeze effects, and if not the priority it is applied with.
When Stacking is Enabled, freeze effects compound.
For example, two 50% freeze effects will result in a speed 25% of the normal speed.
When Stacking is Disabled, it cannot compound with other unstacked conditions.
If another unstacked condition would be applied, only the one with the higher priority will remain applied.
Note that while only one unstacked condition is used at any given time, stacked freezes can still compound with an unstackable freeze.
The default stacking value is Disabled.
Priority values may be between 0ω to 1000000ω. The default value is 100ω.
Controls if the freeze effect overrides border color of the tank when active.
If multiple effects that would override border color are on a single tank at once, the one with the highest priority wins.
Note that the color you see may be different from others, depending on your selected theme.
The default value is Disabled.

name: Bullet Poison
description: A folder for controling the poison interaction on bullets

elements.text: Controls if bullets can instill the poison effect.
When Enabled, bullets can poison valid targets.
When Disabled, bullets will not cause the poison status condition.
Freeze can be Enabled for Tanks and/or Bullets it hits.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls how long the poison status effect lasts, and how often it chips.
The duration is split up into the number of damage intervals you set.
During each interval, a portion of the total damage is done to the poisoned player.
For example, a 100 damage poison applied over 5s in 10i will deal 10hp in damage every 0.5s for 5s.
The first application of damage is done on the first interval application, and not upon applying the poison.
Duration values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s.
Interval values may be between 1i to 1000000i. The default value is 5i.
Controls how much damage poison does over the course of its application.
Damage is spread out among damage intervals evenly.
Raw Damage is applied as direct hp damage to the tank.
Percentage Damage is applied based on the tank's health when the poison was applied (after the bullet impact damage).
For example, with 10i damage intervals, 10hp raw damage, and 10% percentage damage, a 100hp tank will take a total of 20hp damage;
This total would then be split into 10i intervals of 2hp damage each interval.
Raw Damage values may be between -1000000hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 100hp.
Percentage Damage values may be between -1000000% to 1000000%. The default value is 0%.
Controls if poison is allowed to kill people, or if it will only bring them to a minimum hp.
When Enabled, if poison damage would bring a tank below the minimum health set, it will not be applied that interval.
When Disabled, poison will damage players until it fades, even if it kills them.
Minimum Health is used when Enabled, and acts as the percentage of the tank's max health it cannot be brought below.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the poison is able to stack with other poisons, and if not, the priority it is applied with.
When Stacking is Enabled, the poison effect will be applied even if the tank is already poisoned.
For example, if a tank is hit with two of the same poison effect with stacking Enabled, they both will deal damage at once.
When Stacking is Disabled, it cannot compound with other unstacked poisons.
If another unstacked condition would be applied, only the one with the higher priority will remain applied.
Note that while only one unstacked condition is used at any given time, stackable poisons can still compound with an unstackable poison.
The default stacking value is Disabled.
Priority values may be between 0ω to 1000000ω. The default value is 100ω.
Controls if the poison effect overrides the typical border color when dealing damage.
If multiple effects that would override border color are on a single tank at once, the one with the highest priority wins.
By default, poison doesn't interupt regeneration, but by turning on visual frames it will interupt regen delay every interval.
Note that the color you see may be different from others, depending on your selected theme.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the bullet acts as a landmine.
When Enabled, the bullet will not damage objects it collides with.
Instead, it will arm itself and become fully visible, and when the target leave it will destroy itself.
This counts as the destroy frag event.
Note damage and effects on the landmine will not be used, meaning any damage must come from the frag event.
When Disabled, it will deal damage on collide like normal.
The default value is Disabled.

name: Weapon Lighting
description: A folder for how the bullet casts light

elements.text: Controls if the bullet creates a light bubble around itself.
When Enabled, the bullet will create a light bubble to specifications.
When Disabled, the bullet does not create any light.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls who can see the light bubble or obfuscation cast by the bullet.
Everyone means anyone can see the light made by the bullet.
Enemies Only means only people on the opposite team as the bullet can see its light or obfuscation.
Teammates Only means only people on the same team as the bullet can see its light or obfuscation.
Firer Only means only the person who shot the bullet can see its light or obfuscation.
The default value is Everyone.
Controls the radius of the light cast by the bullet.
Values may be between 0ψ to 1000000ψ. The default value is 5000ψ.
Controls the intensity/opacity of the light cast by the bullet.
For example, a 0% opaque light is useless, and a 100% light fully illuminates an area.
If the light acts as an obfuscator, 0% means nothing is hidden, and 100% means nothing can be seen within the effect.
Values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 90%.
Controls the arc, or starting and ending angle, of the bullet's vision bubble.
The bullet's beam of light begins at the starting arc value, and ends at the ending arc value.
The direction the bullet is facing is used as 0°, and the beam goes clockwise to the endpoint.
For example, an arc of 315° to 45° will create a 90° arc emitted from the front of the bullet.
An arc of 45° to 315° will be do the opposite, and create a 270° arc emitted from the back of the bullet.
Values for both the starting and ending angle may be between 0° to 360°. The default value is a 0° starting angle, and a 360° ending angle.
Controls if the light from the bullet can go pierce walls and other vision blockers.
When Enabled, the light bubble created from bullets will go through walls.
When Disabled, the light bubble created from bullets will be obstructed by vision blockers.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the light bubble created by the bullet instead acts to obfuscate/conceal the area it covers.
When Enabled, the light will create an opaque field in the area it's light bubble would touch.
The color of this opaque field can be controlled.
Enemies will see the field in the set opacity, friendly tanks will see the field at 20% the set opacity.
This is to allow them to plan around the field, without it obstructing their vision.
When Disabled, the light will function like a normal light.
You may choose the have the effect render over areas players can't see.
You may also allow players who aren't included in the visibility of the light to still see an outline of it.
The default value is Disabled.

name: Weapon Particle Spawning
description: A folder for how weapons can call on and use other weapons

name: Fragment Bombing
description: A folder for how bullets fire other weapons when they die

elements.text: Controls what death events will trigger the frag weapon to be fired.
Destruction type death generally occurs whenever a bullet dies from an impact, such as colliding with a tank.
Self-Destruct type death occurs whenever the self-destruct button is triggered on the bullet.
Range type death occurs whenever the bullet runs out of range, and it subsequently removed.
Multiple events can be Enabled or Disabled at the same time for a bullet.
The default value for all is Disabled.
Controls what weapon is fired by the bullet when it dies.
The weapon is fired from the perspective of the bullet, but attributes are scaled from the perspective of the tank.
For example, bullet speed of a fragged weapon is not based on the bullet's speed, but still based on the tank's speed.
If no weapon is selected, no weapon will be fired durng the frag event.
Note that only one shot is fired, meaning ammo and reload are obsolete for fragmented weapons.
Weapons are referenced by id, meaning changing the name or properties of the weapon will not force you to change this setting.

name: General Particle Release
description: A folder for how bullets fire other weapons while alive

elements.text: Controls if the bullet fired bullets over an interval of time.
When Enabled, the bullet will fire the specified weapon during the specified interval.
When Disabled, the bullet will not fire other bullets.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the period of time between each release of a bullet.
For example, a bullet with 0.5s delay will attempt to fire twice per second.
When Locked is Enabled, the bullet will keep the same interval its whole life.
When Locked is Disabled, the bullet can vary it's interval between each fire if the interval is random.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 1s, with Locked Enabled.
Controls if the bullet will create particles when bouncing against objects.
When Enabled, bouncing will fire the attached particle.
When Disabled, bouncing does not create particles.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the period of time during which the bullet will create particles.
Release Delay controls how long the bullet must initially wait until it is able to fire its weapon.
Release Duration controls the total time the bullet is able to produce bullets after the delay.
A Release Duration of 0s means the bullet will fire its weapon until it is destroyed.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 3s Delay, with 0s Duration.
Controls the maximum amount of times the bullet can fire its weapon.
Bounce release and Passive Release both count towards this limit.
If the limit is reached and the bullet would attempt to fire again, instead nothing happens.
A value of 0b means no limit on firing exists.
Values may be between 0b to 1000000b. The default value is 0b.
Controls what weapon is fired by the bullet when it creates a particle.
The weapon is fired from the perspective of the bullet, but attributes are scaled from the perspective of the tank.
For example, bullet speed of a fragged weapon is not based on the bullet's speed, but still based on the tank's speed.
If no weapon is selected, no weapon will be fired durng the particle event.
Weapons are referenced by id, meaning changing the name or properties of the weapon will not force you to change this setting.

name: Weapon Multifiring
description: A folder for linking multiple weapons to fire at once.

elements.text: Controls what other weapons is fired in conjunction with the equipped weapon.
When a weapon is attached to this, it will be fired with the attached weapon.
When a weapon finished a round, the weapon will automatically switch to the multifired bullet weapon.
If the attached weapon also has a multifired bullet attachment, it will then switch to its own attachment, and so on.
This process continues until an attached weapon does not have a multifire, after which the gun returns to the base type.
The entire loop of attached weapons will use 1 round from the main gun. Attached weapons are linked to the initial gun's rounds.
For example, say Gun A has Gun B attached, with Gun A having 3 rounds of 1 shot each, and Gun B having 100 rounds of 2 shots each.
Gun A would fire once (its entire round), switch to gun B which fires twice, then switch back to Gun A.
This would happen a total of 3 times before the powerup is unequipped, since Gun A, the initial weapon, has 3 rounds.
Weapons are referenced by id, meaning changing the name or properties of the weapon will not force you to change this setting.
Controls if multifired weapons shoot their shots at the same time, or split.
When Enabled, multifired weapons will fire at the same time.
This means that when Enabled, the reload and ammo of weapons are ignored, except for the initial.
The initial attachment controls this setting for all attachments in the loop.
For example, we'll use Gun A and Gun B from the example in Multifired Bullets.
If Enabled, Gun A will shoot a bullet the same time Gun B shoots, causing two bullets to fire at once.
Since Gun A then runs out of Round Ammo, a round is used, despite Gun B still having another shot.
This results in the gun firing two bullets three times before the powerup is unequipped.
When Disabled, the standard behavior is used where attachments use their round before swapping.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if multifired weapons use the initial weapon's round reload.
If Syncronize Fire is Enabled, this setting is obsolete since only the initial weapon's reload is used.
When Enabled, every round will share the initial weapon's round reload.
For Example, if Gun A has 1s round reload and attached Gun B has 3s round reload, when Enabled both will use 1s round reload.
Note that shot reloads will be retained, this only affects the reload after a round is fully used.
If Disabled, the round reload will be retained for each weapon.
In the previous example, Gun A will finish with 1s wait, then Gun B will finish with 3s wait before looping back to Gun A.
Important to note is round reloads always apply after the round is emptied.
The default value is Enabled.

name: Weapon Parent Effects
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the firing tank

elements.text: Controls if parent effects are applied on collection of the powerup, and if it grants a weapon.
When Enabled, effects are applied when the powerup is collected as well as when it is fired.
When Disabled, parent effects will only occur when firing the weapon.
You can optionally choose to disable bullets. Apply On Collect is always treated as enabled if bullets are disabled.
If bullets are disabled, the powerup will be automatically removed when collected, however parent effects will still be applied.
Finally, you may choose to have effects only apply when hitting a target.
If Apply On Hit is enabled, Disable Bullets and Apply On Collect are overridden to Disabled.
If any tank is hit by a bullet with Apply On Hit Enabled, the effects will be automatically applied to the hit tank.
The default value for all three is Disabled.

name: Change Parent Opacity
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the player's opacity

elements.text: Controls if the powerup changes the parent tank's opacity when effects are activated.
When Enabled, the opacity change is applied during effects.
When Disabled, no opacity change is applied to the parent.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the range of opacity the tank goes through when effects are active.
Effect Opacity is the opacity the tank sits at for the duration of the opacity change.
The Final value is used for interpolation, and is the final value reached before the tank returns to normal opacity.
Values are applied as percentages of the tank's base opacity.
Multiple opacity effects on a parent will stack, such that 2 50% opacity effects result in a 25% opaque parent.
values may be between 0% to 100%. The default value is 0% to 100%.
Controls the time it takes for the parent to switch in and out of the effect's opacity.
Effect Duration controls the total time the parent will spend at the initial effect level.
The Effect Interpolation is added once to the end for Ease In effect changes, or twice for Ease In And Out.
For example, a 4s duration with Ease In And Out and 2s lerp, will fade out over 2s, stay hidden for 4s, and fade in over 2s.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s Duration and 1s Interpolation.
Controls the way opacity changes are interpolated.
No Easing means the effect is applied instantly, and is removed instantly.
Ease In means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied, and is removed instantly.
Ease Out means the effect is instantly applied, and uses the interpolation timer when being removed.
Ease In And Out means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied and removed.
The default value is Ease In And Out.

name: Change Parent Speed
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the player's speed

elements.text: Controls if the powerup changes the parent tank's speed when effects are activated.
When Enabled, the speed change is applied during effects.
When Disabled, no speed change is applied to the parent.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the range of speed the tank goes through when effects are active.
Effect Speed is the speed the tank sits at for the duration of the speed change.
The Final value is used for interpolation, and is the final value reached before the tank returns to normal speed.
Values are applied as percentages of the tank's base speed, and negative values represent inverted movement.
Multiple speed effects on a parent will stack, such that a 50% and -50% speed effect will result in a -25% speed parent.
values may be between -1000000% to 1000000%. The default value is 150% to 100%.
Controls the time it takes for the parent to switch in and out of the effect's speed.
Effect Duration controls the total time the parent will spend at the initial effect level.
The Effect Interpolation is added once to the end for Ease In effect changes, or twice for Ease In And Out.
For example, a 4s duration with Ease In And Out and 2s lerp, will speed up over 2s, remain fast for 4s, and slow down over 2s.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s Duration and 1s Interpolation.
Controls the way speed changes are interpolated.
No Easing means the effect is applied instantly, and is removed instantly.
Ease In means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied, and is removed instantly.
Ease Out means the effect is instantly applied, and uses the interpolation timer when being removed.
Ease In And Out means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied and removed.
The default value is Ease In And Out.

name: Change Parent Vision
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the player's vision

elements.text: Controls if the powerup changes the parent tank's vision when effects are activated.
When Enabled, the vision change is applied during effects.
When Disabled, no vision change is applied to the parent.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the range of vision the tank goes through when effects are active.
Effect Vision is the vision the tank sits at for the duration of the vision change.
The Final value is used for interpolation, and is the final value reached before the tank returns to normal vision.
Values are applied as percentages of the tank's base vision.
Multiple vision effects on a parent will stack, such that a 200% and 25% vision effect will result in a 50% vision parent.
values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value is 150% to 100%.
Controls the time it takes for the parent to switch in and out of the effect's vision.
Effect Duration controls the total time the parent will spend at the initial effect level.
The Effect Interpolation is added once to the end for Ease In effect changes, or twice for Ease In And Out.
For example, a 4s duration with Ease In And Out and 2s lerp, will zoom out over 2s, remain zoomed for 4s, and zoom back in over 2s.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s Duration and 1s Interpolation.
Controls the way vision changes are interpolated.
No Easing means the effect is applied instantly, and is removed instantly.
Ease In means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied, and is removed instantly.
Ease Out means the effect is instantly applied, and uses the interpolation timer when being removed.
Ease In And Out means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied and removed.
The default value is Ease In And Out.

name: Change Parent Bubble
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the player's bubble

elements.text: Controls if the powerup changes the parent tank's bubble when effects are activated.
When Enabled, the bubble change is applied during effects.
When Disabled, no bubble change is applied to the parent.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the range of bubble sizes the tank goes through when effects are active.
Effect Bubble is the bubble size the tank sits at for the duration of the bubble change.
The Final value is used for interpolation, and is the final value reached before the tank returns to normal bubble size.
Values are applied as percentages of the tank's base bubble size.
Multiple bubble effects on a parent will stack, such that two 50% bubble effects will result in a 25% bubble size parent.
values may be between 0% to 1000000%. The default value is 150% to 100%.
Controls the time it takes for the parent to switch in and out of the effect's bubble size.
Effect Duration controls the total time the parent will spend at the initial effect level.
The Effect Interpolation is added once to the end for Ease In effect changes, or twice for Ease In And Out.
For example, a 4s duration with Ease In And Out and 2s lerp, will expand the bubble over 2s, maintain it for 4s, and detract over 2s.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 5s Duration and 1s Interpolation.
Controls the way bubble changes are interpolated.
No Easing means the effect is applied instantly, and is removed instantly.
Ease In means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied, and is removed instantly.
Ease Out means the effect is instantly applied, and uses the interpolation timer when being removed.
Ease In And Out means the effect uses the interpolation timer when applied and removed.
The default value is Ease In And Out.
Controls if the player's bubble visibility is changed by the powerup.
Note the change is applied before Ease In, and is only taken off after Ease Out is done.
If multiple effects that would change visibility type are applied at once, the most recent one is used.
No Change means that the player's exisiting visibility type is kept.
Everyone means that all other players will have the parent's light source appear.
Teammates Only allows for tanks on the parent's team to see their camera's light source.
Self Only means that only the parent can see their camera's light source.
The default value is No Change.
Controls if the player's bubble wall piercing is changed by the powerup.
Note the change is applied before Ease In, and is only taken off after Ease Out is done.
If multiple effects that would change wall pierce type are applied at once, the most recent one is used.
No Change means that the player's exisiting wall pierce type is kept.
Enabled means that the player's bubble and vision will pierce walls while the effect is active.
Disabled means the player's bubble and vision will be obstructed by obstacles and walls.
The default value is No Change.

name: Change Parent Health
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the player's bubble

elements.text: Controls if the powerup changes the parent tank's health when effects are activated.
When Enabled, the health change is applied during effects.
When Disabled, no health change is applied to the parent.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the amount the player's health changes by when effects are triggered.
Negative values are damage, positive numbers are healing.
Values may be between -1000000hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 100hp.

name: Parent Shield
description: A folder for how firing the weapon changes the player's shield

elements.text: Controls if the player gains a shield when using this powerup.
When Enabled, a shield is formed around the player when they fire.
When Disabled, no shield is gained or formed.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the shield rebounds bullets off it, or if it simply defends the tank.
When Enabled, a shield is physically represented by the circle it makes around the tank.
Bullets that hit this circle are reflected off, as if they had hit the circle.
Their damage is done to the shield and it counts as a hit, however the bullet's health is unaffected.
You can optionally set the radius of the shield's bubble as a percentage of the tank's size.
When Disabled, the shield directly prevents damage against bullets that hit the tank, and bullets are destroyed like they collided.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the maximum amount of objects that can collide with the shield.
If a shield exceeds its max hits, it will be removed no matter its remaining hp.
For example, a 5b shield with 100hp will be removed if hit by 5 1hp bullets.
A value of 0b means the shield can take an infinite number of hits.
Values may be between 0b to 1000000b. The default value is 0b.
Controls the maximum amount of damage the shield can take before failing.
Damage bullets would deal to the tank are instead dealt to the shield.
If the total damage the shield has prevented exceeds this value, the shield breaks.
You can choose to have damage dealt over the shield's remaining health to be overflowed onto the tank, or discarded.
A value of 0hp means the shield can take an infinite amount of damage.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 100hp.
Controls the maximum time the shield lasts before being removed.
The timer starts when the shield effect is applied, and when it reaches 0 the shield is removed.
A value of 0s means the shield lasts until physically destroyed.
Values may be between 0s to 600s. The default value is 0s.
Controls the shield's resistance to damage.
This resistance is separate of the tank's resistance to damage, and decreases the damage dealt to the shield's defense when hit.
Bullets lowered to 0 damage still count as hits against the shield, but do not remove any defense.
Values may be between 0hp to 1000000hp. The default value is 0hp.
Controls if the shield can stack, and what takes priority.
When Enabled, the shield is able to stack on top of all other shields.
When Disabled, the shield cannot stack with other unstacked shields.
If an unstackable shield exists and another unstacked shield would be added, the one with higher priority remains.
Note that stackable effects can be stacked on unstacked shields, but only 1 unstacked shield can exist at a time.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls the color of the bubble denoting the shield.
If multiple shields are on a single tank at once, multiple shield bubbles are drawn at once.
You can optionally also choose the opacity the shield will be draw at, with 0% being invisible and 100% being opaque.
Note that the color you see may be different from others, depending on your selected theme.
The default value is Disabled.

name: Parent Powerup Inheriting
description: A folder for what powerups tank inherit from this

elements.text: Controls when the powerup will deliver a powerup the parent tank's inventory.
Note an inherited powerup automatically triggers pickup effects when delivered to inventory.
Inherit On Pickup places the powerup in inventory as soon as the powerup is collected.
Powerups that start in the tank's inventory do not trigger the pickup event, but other inherited powerups do.
Inherit On Fire puts the inherited powerup in inventory every single time the powerup successfully fires.
Inherit On Removal puts the inherited powerup in inventory whenever this powerup is removed from inventory.
Controls where delivered powerups are put.
Automatically Equip means collected powerups are put over existing equipped powerups when delivered.
Equip Over Default means that delivered powerups will only equip over weapons with the Treat As Default setting Enabled.
Collect Unequipped means the powerup is put in the back of the player's backpack when delivered.
The default value is Collect Unequipped.

name: Miscellaneous Weapon
description: A folder for various random things weapons and bullets can do

elements.text: Controls if and how the bullet is able to be self-destructed.
Never means the bullet will never self-destruct, and can only die from destruction or range.
Ability Key means that pressing the player's ability key triggers the self-destruct effect on bullets from this weapon.
Ability And Fire Key means that pressing the player's ability key, or the fire key will trigger self-destruction.
Any Key means that moving, pressing the ability key, or pressing the fire key will trigger self-destruction.
The default value is Never.
Controls if bullets fired by the weapon steal the player's camera until they die.
When Enabled, the bullets fired by the weapon will steal the tank's camera.
This means that instead of the camera being centered on the tank, the camera is centered on the bullet.
This lasts until the bullet dies, by any means.
The camera is stolen by the most recently fired bullet that steals it.
When Disabled, the tank retains its camera when firing.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if bullets fired by the weapon steal the player's controls until they die.
When Enabled, the bullets fired by the weapon will steal the tank's controls.
This means the rotation of the bullet can be controlled by the rotate keys, and movement by the front and back keys.
Note that while being controlled, effects that change the bullet's rotation and velocity will not apply.
While the bullet is controlled, the tank cannot move or fire new bullets.
The control override lasts until the bullet dies, by any means.
If multicontrol is on, the bullet may be controlled at the same time as other bullets with control stealing.
If a bullet without multicontrol is fired, all other control events are canceled immediately.
You may also optionally force the bullet to move, and only give the controllers freedom of rotation.
The rotation speed of the bullet, and if it bounces on walls when forced motion is on, can be configured.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if tanks can drop full or partially used versions of this weapon.
When Enabled, pressing the unequip button will drop a powerup bubble on the ground of the tank's current equipped powerup.
The powerup will be in the exact state it was in when dropped (ex- reload, ammo, precomputed attributes).
When Disabled, the tank must fully use the powerup to get rid of it.
If unequipping is on, you may optionally choose to not delete the powerup but instead have the leftover powerup form a powerup bubble.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if tanks keep their powerups when dying.
When Enabled, the powerup will be kept when the tank dies.
When Disabled, the tank will lose the powerup during death.
The default value is Disabled.
Controls if the health bars of the fired bullets are visible to all players.
When Enabled, the bullets fired will have visible health bars.
When Disabled, the bullets will have their health hidden.
The default value is Disabled.
